After breaking the record previously held by French champion Yan
Cohen, Vietnamese contestant
Dang Ngoc Phuong Trinh from Di Linh
Lam Dong has officially become the
world champion in random image memory.  At the
2023 World Memory Championship taking place in Mumbai, India from November
contestant Da Ngoc Phuong Trinh
correctly remembered 618 random images in 5
minutes, breaking the world record.  Previously
there were 547 images. Therefore, the contest organizers
decided to increase the number of images
to 740 images for the
next Super Memory World Championship competition so that
contestants from all countries can strive to break the record.
Vietnam's World Championship this year,
now I feel extremely happy
because today I was able to bring the
gold medal to the Vietnamese team
in the world super memory arena.
I Love Vietnam  I'm Proud to Be
Vietnamese Two Vietnamese generations came to
India to participate in the tournament, two biological sisters
Dang Ngoc Phuong Trinh and Dang Thu Hien
to jointly set a Vietnamese record for super
memory since 2019 through the training program.

Nguyen Phung Phong, the Vietnamese national flag
appeared proudly on the night of awarding the
gold medal to Ngoc Phuong Trinh,

This affordable cooking Biofuel consists of ethanol

and animal oils, green diesel from algae,
and methane from animal manure and
Other organic materials, Biofuel is
much cheaper than using gas, cooks just
as quickly and is not harmful to
health. Biofuel is considered a
future solution because it is clean and
renewable.  However, according to experts,
it takes more ethanol than gasoline to produce the same
amount of energy. At the same time, it will be
extremely wasteful if ethanol production
creates an increased demand for specialized arable land
for biological crops.

Indian officials said they were about to
successfully rescue 41 workers trapped in a
tunnel in the state of Uttar Khan. After more than two weeks,
rescue forces have reached the location
of the workers.  and is currently installing pipes
to get them
out. On November 28, the Utar
Khan Constitution said the process of installing
pipes in the tunnel to get the workers
out has been completed. Rescuers are
expected to use specialized rolling pins.  To pull
each worker out through the
90 cm wide pipe, this process will last
several hours. Outside the tunnel, dozens of

are also mobilized to quickly
